intro: Euphocarpus, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to parts of Asia and North America. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Euphocarpus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
